preamble.p: An Act to prevent the recovery of debts from certain classes of workmen by be setting the places where they work or receive their wages and protect such workmen from molestation and intimidation by their creditors

Whereas it is expedient to prevent the recovery of debts from certain classes of workmen by be setting the places where they work or receive their wages and protect such workmen from molestation and intimidation by their creditors;
It is hereby enacted as follows:-

content.p: This Act may be called the Bihar Workmen's Protection Act, 1948.
It extends to the whole of the State of Bihar.
It shall come into force in any local area in the State of Bihar on such date as the State Government may, by notification, appoint.
In this Act unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context,-

"workman" means any person employed by a local authority on a system of public conservancy or sanitation or employed in any industrial establishment to do any skilled unskilled, manual or clerical labour for hire or reward;

item.p: a factory as defined in clause (j) of Section 2 of the Factories Act, 1934;
a railway as defined in clause (4) of Section 2 of the Indian Railways Act, 1890;
the establishment of a person who, for the purpose of fulfilling a contract with the owner of any industrial establishment, employs workman;
workshop or other establishment in which articles are produced, adapted or manufactured with a view to their use, transport or sale;

blockList.listIntroduction: a person who, with intent to cause a workman to abstain from doing or to do any act, which he has a right to do or to abstain from doing,-

item.p: obstruct, or uses violence to, or intimidates, such workman, or
persistently follows such workman from place to place or interferes with any property owned or used by him or deprives him, of, or hinders him in, the use thereof, or
loiters or does any similar act at or near a house or other place where such workman works or carries on business;

content.p: shall be deemed to molest such workman:
Provided that person who attends at or near such house or place in order merely to obtain or communicate information shall not be deemed to molest.

section.heading: Besetting certain places with a view to recover debt

content.p: loiters at or near any place where a workman works or receive his wages in a manner or in circumstances indicating that he is so loitering with a view to review to recover any debt from such workman, or
molests, or abets the molestation of any such workman for the recovery of debt owned by him to his creditor,
shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months or with a fine or with both.

section.heading: Offences under this Act to be cognizable and bailable

content.p: Notwithstanding anything contained in the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898, an offence punishable under this Act shall be cognizable and bailable. Such an offence shall be compoundable with the leave of the Court.
